intro: Physogyne garayana, commonly known as the Garay's physogyne, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. Its leaves are simple, ovate, and covered in a fine pubescence. Physogyne garayana is often found in rocky or dry habitats, thriving in the high-altitude environments of the Andes.
